article_text: BNP leaders demand urgent national elections to restore democracy in Bangladesh. Amir Khosru Mahmud Chowdhury emphasized that polls cannot be delayed further. The interim government faces pressure to announce a timeline.
World Bank reports 5 lakh Bangladeshis fell into extreme poverty due to inflation. Economic policies need reform to address eroding purchasing power and rising costs.
Rohingya refugees continue to flee Myanmar violence. UN World Food Programme calls for urgent aid to support displaced communities in Cox’s Bazar.
Netrokona court sentences stalker to death for killing a schoolgirl in Barhatta. The verdict aims to deter violent crimes against women.
Mobile financial services grow as a tool for social safety nets. Student stipends and remittances are now distributed via MFS, boosting financial inclusion.
Debapriya Bhattacharya questions interim government’s economic policy transparency. He urges open dialogue on reform measures to build trust.
Chelsea’s Enzo Maresca eyes history in Conference League final against Real Betis. Bangladesh fans eagerly follow European football updates.
Residents of Mymensingh’s Dhobaura demand a permanent embankment along Netai river to prevent monsoon flooding.
Israeli offensive displaces 180,000 people in 10 days, says International Organization for Migration. Bangladesh condemns the violence.
Astra Airways honors top business partners at the 2025 Business Partners Award in Dhaka. The event highlights growth in Bangladesh’s aviation sector.
